member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlManager
member.summary: Access control manager. Dictates which connections are permitted or denied.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlManager.Mode
member.summary: Access control mode, either DefaultPermit or DefaultDeny. DefaultPermit: allow everything, except for those explicitly denied. DefaultDeny: deny everything, except for those explicitly permitted.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlManager.Permit(System.String)
member.summary: Permit or deny a request based on IP address. When operating in 'default deny', only specified entries are permitted. When operating in 'default permit', everything is allowed unless explicitly denied.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlMode.DefaultPermit
member.summary: Permit requests from any endpoint by default.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlMode.DefaultDeny
member.summary: Deny requests from any endpoint by default.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Chunk
member.summary: A chunk of data, used when reading from a request where the Transfer-Encoding header includes 'chunked'.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Chunk.Metadata
member.summary: Any additional metadata that appears on the length line after the length hex value and semicolon.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Chunk.IsFinalChunk
member.summary: Indicates whether or not this is the final chunk, i.e. the chunk length received was zero.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.ContentRoute
member.summary: Assign a method handler for when requests are received matching the supplied method and path.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.ContentRoute.Path
member.summary: The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.ContentRoute.IsDirectory
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the path specifies a directory. If so, any matching URL will be handled by the specified handler.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ContentRoute.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Object)
member.param: The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.
Indicates whether or not the path specifies a directory. If so, any matching URL will be handled by the specified handler.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager
member.summary: Content route manager. Content routes are used for GET and HEAD requests to specific files or entire directories.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager.BaseDirectory
member.summary: Base directory for files and directories accessible via content routes.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager.Add(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Object)
member.param: True if the path represents a directory.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager.Get(System.String)
member.returns: ContentRoute if the route exists, otherwise null.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a content route exists.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteHandler
member.summary: Content route handler. Handles GET and HEAD requests to content routes for files and directories.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteHandler.ContentFileMode
member.summary: The FileMode value to use when accessing files within a content route via a FileStream. Default is FileMode.Open.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteHandler.ContentFileAccess
member.summary: The FileAccess value to use when accessing files within a content route via a FileStream. Default is FileAccess.Read.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteHandler.ContentFileShare
member.summary: The FileShare value to use when accessing files within a content route via a FileStream. Default is FileShare.Read.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRoute
member.summary: Assign a method handler for when requests are received matching the supplied method and path regex.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRoute.Method
member.summary: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRoute.Path
member.summary: The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRoute.Handler
member.summary: The handler for the dynamic route.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRoute.#ctor(WatsonWebserver.HttpMethod,System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex,System.Func{WatsonWebserver.HttpContext,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.String,System.Object)
member.param: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.
The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.
The method that should be called to handle the request.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRouteAttribute
member.summary: Attribute that is used to mark methods as a dynamic route.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRouteAttribute.Method
member.summary: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRouteAttribute.Path
member.summary: The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched. Must be convertible to a regular expression.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRouteAttribute.#ctor(WatsonWebserver.HttpMethod,System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.param: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.
The regular expression pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRouteManager
member.summary: Dynamic route manager. Dynamic routes are used for requests using any HTTP method to any path that can be matched by regular expression.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRouteManager.Matcher
member.summary: Directly access the underlying regular expression matching library. This is helpful in case you want to specify the matching behavior should multiple matches exist.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRouteManager.Exists(WatsonWebserver.HttpMethod,System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex)
member.summary: Check if a content route exists.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRouteManager.Match(WatsonWebserver.HttpMethod,System.String,WatsonWebserver.DynamicRoute@)
member.summary: Match a request method and URL to a handler method.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.HttpContext
member.summary: HTTP context including both request and response.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpContext.Request
member.summary: The HTTP request that was received.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpContext.Response
member.summary: The HTTP response that will be sent. This object is preconstructed on your behalf and can be modified directly.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.HttpMethod
member.summary: HTTP methods, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.TimestampUtc
member.summary: UTC timestamp from when the request was received.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ThreadId
member.summary: Thread ID on which the request exists.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Method
member.summary: The HTTP method used in the request.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Headers
member.summary: The headers found in the request.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Keepalive
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the client requested HTTP keepalives.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ChunkedTransfer
member.summary: Indicates whether or not chunked transfer encoding was detected.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Gzip
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the payload has been gzip compressed.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Deflate
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the payload has been deflate compressed.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Useragent
member.summary: The useragent specified in the request.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ContentType
member.summary: The content type as specified by the requestor (client).

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ContentLength
member.summary: The number of bytes in the request body.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Data
member.summary: The stream from which to read the request body sent by the requestor (client).

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DataAsBytes
member.summary: Retrieve the request body as a byte array. This will fully read the stream.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DataAsString
member.summary: Retrieve the request body as a string. This will fully read the stream.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ListenerContext
member.summary: The original HttpListenerContext from which the HttpRequest was constructed.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.#ctor(System.Net.HttpListenerContext)
member.summary: HTTP request. Instantiate the object using an HttpListenerContext.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.RetrieveHeaderValue(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a specified header value from either the headers or the querystring (case insensitive).

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.HeaderExists(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.param: Specify whether a case sensitive search should be used.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.QuerystringExists(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determine if a querystring entry exists.
member.param: Specify whether a case sensitive search should be used.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ReadChunk(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: For chunked transfer-encoded requests, read the next chunk. It is strongly recommended that you use the ChunkedTransfer parameter before invoking this method.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DataAsJsonObject``1
member.summary: Read the data stream fully and convert the data to the object type specified using JSON deserialization. Note: if you use this method, you will not be able to read from the data stream afterward.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.SourceDetails.Port
member.summary: TCP port from which the request originated on the requestor.

member.param: TCP port from which the request originated on the requestor.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DestinationDetails.IpAddress
member.summary: IP address to which the request was made.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DestinationDetails.Port
member.summary: TCP port on which the request was received.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DestinationDetails.Hostname
member.summary: Hostname to which the request was directed.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DestinationDetails.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.param: IP address to which the request was made.
TCP port on which the request was received.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.UrlDetails.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters found within the URL, if using parameter routes.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.StatusCode
member.summary: The HTTP status code to return to the requestor (client).

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.StatusDescription
member.summary: The HTTP status description to return to the requestor (client).

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Headers
member.summary: User-supplied headers to include in the response.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.ContentType
member.summary: User-supplied content-type to include in the response.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of the supplied response data.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.ChunkedTransfer
member.summary: Indicates whether or not chunked transfer encoding should be indicated in the response.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.DataAsString
member.summary: Retrieve the response body sent using a Send() or SendAsync() method.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.DataAsBytes
member.summary: Retrieve the response body sent using a Send() or SendAsync() method.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Data
member.summary: Response data stream sent to the requestor.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Send(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers and no data to the requestor and terminate the connection.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Send(System.Int64,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers with a specified content length and no data to the requestor and terminate the connection. Useful for HEAD requests where the content length must be set.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Send(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers and data to the requestor and terminate the connection.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Send(System.Byte[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers and data to the requestor and terminate the connection.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Send(System.Int64,System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers and data to the requestor and terminate.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.SendChunk(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers (if not already sent) and a chunk of data using chunked transfer-encoding, and keep the connection in-tact.
member.param: Number of bytes to send from the chunk, i.e. the actual data size (for example, return value of FileStream.ReadAsync(buffer, 0, buffer.Length)).
Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

members.member:
Send headers (if not already sent) and the final chunk of data using chunked transfer-encoding and terminate the connection.
Chunk of data./// Number of bytes to send from the chunk, i.e. the actual data size (for example, return value of FileStream.ReadAsync(buffer, 0, buffer.Length)). Cancellation token useful for canceling the request. True if successful.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.DataAsJsonObject``1
member.summary: Convert the response data sent using a Send() method to the object type specified using JSON deserialization.

member.summary: Retrieve MIME type from file extension.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ObjectExtensions.ToJson(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return a JSON string of the object.

member.summary: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.ParameterRouteAttribute
member.summary: Attribute that is used to mark methods as a parameter route.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.ParameterRouteAttribute.Path
member.summary: The path to match, i.e. /{version}/api/{id}. If a match is found, the Dictionary found in HttpRequest.Url.Parameters will contain keys for 'version' and 'id'.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.ParameterRouteAttribute.Method
member.summary: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ParameterRouteAttribute.#ctor(WatsonWebserver.HttpMethod,System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.param: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.ParameterRouteManager
member.summary: Parameter route manager. Parameter routes are used for requests using any HTTP method to any path where parameters are defined in the URL. For example, /{version}/api. For a matching URL, the HttpRequest.Url.Parameters will contain a key called 'version' with the value found in the URL.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.ParameterRouteManager.Matcher
member.summary: Directly access the underlying URL matching library. This is helpful in case you want to specify the matching behavior should multiple matches exist.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ParameterRouteManager.Get(WatsonWebserver.HttpMethod,System.String)
member.returns: ParameterRoute if the route exists, otherwise null.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ParameterRouteManager.Exists(WatsonWebserver.HttpMethod,System.String)
member.summary: Check if a content route exists.

member.summary: Match a request method and URL to a handler method.

member.summary: Indicates whether or not the server is listening.

member.summary: Number of requests being serviced currently.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Server.Events
member.summary: Set specific actions/callbacks to use when events are raised.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Server.Pages
member.summary: Default pages served by Watson webserver.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Server.#ctor(WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverSettings,System.Func{WatsonWebserver.HttpContext,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Watson webserver. If you do not provide a settings object, default settings will be used, which will cause Watson Webserver to listen on http://127.0.0.1:8000, and send events to the console.
member.param: Method used when a request is received and no matching routes are found. Commonly used as the 404 handler when routes are used.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Server.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Func{WatsonWebserver.HttpContext,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Watson webserver.
member.param: Hostname or IP address on which to listen.
TCP port on which to listen.
Specify whether or not SSL should be used (HTTPS).
Method used when a request is received and no matching routes are found. Commonly used as the 404 handler when routes are used.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Server.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Func{WatsonWebserver.HttpContext,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Watson webserver.
member.param: Hostnames or IP addresses on which to listen. Note: multiple listener endpoints are not supported on all platforms.
TCP port on which to listen.
Specify whether or not SSL should be used (HTTPS).
Method used when a request is received and no matching routes are found. Commonly used as the 404 handler when routes are used.

member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the server.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Server.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tear down the server and dispose of background workers. Do not use this object after disposal.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverEvents
member.summary: Callbacks/actions to use when various events are encountered.

member.summary: Method to use for sending log messages.

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverEvents.ConnectionReceived
member.summary: Event to fire when a connection is received.

member.summary: Event to fire when a request is received.

member.summary: Event to fire when a request is denied due to access control.

member.summary: Event to fire when an exception is encountered.

member.summary: Event to fire when the server is started.

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverEvents.ServerStopped
member.summary: Event to fire when the server is stopped.

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverEvents.ServerDisposing
member.summary: Event to fire when the server is being disposed.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverPages
member.summary: Default pages served by Watson webserver.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverPages.Default404Page
member.summary: Page displayed when sending a 404 due to a lack of a route.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverPages.Default500Page
member.summary: Page displayed when sending a 500 due to an exception is unhandled within your routes.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverPages.#ctor
member.summary: Default pages served by Watson webserver.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverRoutes.Preflight
member.summary: Function to call when a preflight (OPTIONS) request is received. Often used to handle CORS. Leave null to use the default OPTIONS handler.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverRoutes.PreRouting
member.summary: Function to call prior to routing. Return 'true' if the connection should be terminated. Return 'false' to allow the connection to continue routing.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverRoutes.Content
member.summary: Content routes; i.e. routes to specific files or folders for GET and HEAD requests.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverRoutes.Static
member.summary: Static routes; i.e. routes with explicit matching and any HTTP method.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverRoutes.Parameter
member.summary: Parameter routes; i.e. routes with parameters embedded in the URL, such as /{version}/api/{id}.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverRoutes.Dynamic
member.summary: Dynamic routes; i.e. routes with regex matching and any HTTP method.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverRoutes.Default
member.summary: Default route; used when no other routes match.

member.summary: Instantiate the object using default settings.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.WatsonWebserverStatistics.RequestCountByMethod(WatsonWebserver.HttpMethod)
member.summary: Retrieve the number of requests received using a specific HTTP method.
member.returns: Number of requests received using this method.
